author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four disciples of Nithyananda on Monday were removed from Sadhus Mutt at Vedaranyam.

A group of followers of a Salem-based Athmananda Swamy Mutt, who entered the Sadhus Mutt, had asked them to vacate it by citing a High Court order, leading to clash between the two groups.

On information, the police rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control. Both the groups claimed right to stay in the Mutt. Following this, the police and revenue officials held negotiations with them.

The supporters of Athmananda, who was originally administering the Sadhus Mutt, asked the Nithyananda followers to vacate the Mutt by showing a High Court order. The followers of Nithyananda were asked to vacate the mutt immediately.
title: Nithyananda’s disciples evicted from Mutt
